author: tobrien
title: Hyper-Localizable Wallet for Africa
description: Diverse personas, languages (2000+), TELCO SLAs, threat metrics, customer budgets, devices..

assessments.note: The proposal meets the objectives of the challenge very well, because it intends to create a very comprehensive wallet, it can be said. The intention is to build an application that dialogs with the diversity of the public, whether through languages, education level, the fact that on the continent it is common for more than one person to use the same cell phone, etc. All these factors would be taken into account , I found a project that seeks to mold itself to the shape of its audience, which is very positive.
This is a proposal with real usability, that could help grow the Cardano community across the African continent, while building a wallet app that adapts to the real situation on the ground.
The proposal addresses the challenge but lacks a bit of clarity when describing the problem. A detailed description of the solution is needed in order to better communicate the project.
assessments.reply: great! clearly explains what need to be improved. I can take this data point and improve on my next proposal

assessments.note: Although the problem statement doesn't clearly state the problem, after reading through the proposal it is clear to me as a westerner. The proposer is in tune with the needs of the african continent has has considered them in the proposal.
A wallet with optimized user interfaces for the African market sounds like a very good approach to promote further distribution.

The idea of creating a skeuomorphic wallet for these communities is ingenius and could have high impact on the adoption by potential users. If proven successful, it could easily be applied to regions across the entire world without needing to alter the core system.

assessments.note: What isn't clear is how this wallet will communicate with the block chain and batch the transactions. There is a risk here that batching between isolated versions of the ledger could have inaccurate accounts between them, how would this issue be resolved? Either through a central database or directly on the chain? maybe using non-interactive proofs? The proposal hits on many specific needs but is lacking details in key blockchain considerations.
assessments.reply: "isolated versions of the ledger" is a problem.  We  support batching but don't  require it. Batching is however required  by many applications such a DEXs , you are pointing out a huge issue if it exists. This is valuable information but does not really effect the app release or timeline. This problem may not exist on release day.

assessments.note:
The proposal provided very useful information. Yet there are a few things that could have been better. 
The problem statement and solution were initially not very clear. I believe that the cause of this was that there was an effort to cram as much information as possible in there, compromising clarity. 
The funding breakdown was quite limited. It stated that the work would cost ~25k USD and the total request would be 29k USD. To imrpove this, it should be broken down further so the community can form an idea of cost distribution. 
How the app would create revenue is also unclear. Would it take a transaction fee or a one time purchase from the app store? In terms of metrics, it would be useful to set a goal to measure success. (How many users after 3/6/9 months?)
assessments.reply: Not sure why revenue is mentioned. There is no plan to generate revenue from the app. Why does the app have to create revenue?
